name: Eirika
title: Eirika
text:
Eirika is the princess of Renais, only daughter of King Fado of Renais, and the younger twin sister of Prince Ephraim.
<red>Proficiency:</><icon>Sword</><icon>Light</><icon>Dark</><icon>Anima</>
Eirika's PRF weapons are focused on rapiers, and magic. The rapiers have a thunder element and are effective vs. armors, horses, and drenched units.

name: Seth
title: Seth
text: Seth is a brave and clever knight of Renais and serves as protector and advisor to Eirika and Ephraim. He is better known as the Silver Knight.

name: Ephraim
title: Ephraim
text:
Ephraim is the crown prince of Renais and Eirika's older twin brother.{br}
He is a headstrong and determined man whose skill with a Lance is unsurpassed by any other in his country, having been taught by Duessel.

name: Inventory
title: Inventory
text: You have 7 inventory slots now. In exchange, the part of the interface that showed things like damage, accuracy, avoid and crit is gone.

name: Accessories
title: Accessories
text: Similar to Thracia 776, there are held scrolls and other accesories that give skills. These accessories have a slight negative effect, but their positive skill compensates for it.

name: Monster Weapons
title: Monster Weapons
text: Instead of being items, monster weapons have their own weapon rank.

name: Durability
title: Durability
text: This time you don't have to worry about durability. Instead, some weapons have a cooldown system, which makes them unusable for a few turns. Myrrh won't be at risk of losing her Dragonstone.

name: Staves
title: Staves

name: Damage Formulas
title: Damage Formulas
text:
Some weapons use damage formulas that aren't Strength for physical weapons and Magic for magical weapons such as Speed instead of Strength. Other weapons have a formula that uses 2 or more stats.
There are also combat staves and tomes that use Strength. If a weapon uses a formula that isn't the usual, it will be mentioned in the description.

name: Heavy Weapons
title: Heavy Weapons

name: Extra Effects
title: Extra Effects
text: Some weapons have special properties besides the typical ones for their type. These properties include skills, combat arts, status effects, stats improvement and even water walking.

name: Multi Weapons
title: Multi Weapons
text: There are items that contain more than one weapon. These weapons can't be stolen from enemies.

name: Bows
title: Bows
text: Bows have better range than in the original. Most bows have 2-3 range, and some may have 5, 6, or even more range.

name: Other Changes
title: Other Changes

name: Bosses
title: Bosses
text:
From chapter 5 onwards, bosses will have an ability that works like in Engage (the boss will revive a number of times). 
Those bosses will also have special weapons with better range and an ability that lets them counter at any distance. You can't steal those weapons nor can you cheese them with bows or light magic.

name: Minibosses
title: Minibosses
text: Starting in chapter 7, there will be minibosses that drop weapons. Some of these bosses have the revival skill that the boss of the chapter has, but they are weaker.

name: Weapon Triangle
title: Weapon Triangle
text: The weapon triangle's effects can be higher than in the original games. They can affect your critical hit rate against enemies. {br}Bows are part of the weapon triangle and have an advantage against magic.

name: Weather
title: Weather
text: Some unit's have a Prf weapon with a skill that summons a weather effect like a sandstorm. You can stack several weather effects, but it will require effort. Weather doesn't slow down your units.

name: Growths
title: Growths
text:
Growth rates are now visible in your unit's info. Your units' growths can change in several ways:
Promoting: Now, besides gaining stats, your units get bonus growths upon promoting. A unit that starts purely physical/magic can end up being a mixed attacker.
Conversations: some base convos can improve an unit's growths.
Held items: items that used to be stats boosters or promotion items are now held items that among their effects, can improve a unit's growth rates. Metis Tome's effects have been improved.
All of your units have Con and Mov growths, so they have a chance to level up those stats.

name: Pair Up
title: Pair Up
text:
In Fire Emblem Awakening and Fates, Pair Up is a mechanic that has things in common with Rescue. You combine two units and keep one of the units safe. Pair Up isn't affected by a unit's constitution.
Pair Up gives bonuses to the lead unit, with the bonuses depending on the class of the secondary unit. 
The higher tier a unit is, the higher the bonus that unit gives will be. The total bonus depends on the unit's current and past classes.
Examples:{br}Wyvern Knight Tana and Wyvern Knight Cormag give different Pair Up bonuses. 
While they both give bonuses from the Wyvern Knight class, Tana also gives bonuses from the Pegasus Knight class and Cormag gives bonuses from the Wyvern Rider class.
Assassin Joshua and Assassin Colm give bonus from the Assassin class. Joshua gives bonuses from the Myrmidon class and Colm gives bonuses from the Thief class.
The type of Pair Up bonuses are the following (if two bonuses are listed together it's because they count as the same):  
Lord/Manakete{br}Knight{br}Cavalier{br}Pegasus{br}Priest/Cleric
Fighter{br}Pirate{br}Archer/Thief{br}Monk/Dancer{br}Mage
Myrmidon{br}Mercenary{br}Wyvern{br}Shaman
Priest/Cleric Pair Up makes lead unit inmune to negative status and heals a bit of health at the start of the turn.

name: Defense Gauge
title: Defense Gauge
text:
While paired up, a gauge meter  increases by 2 every time your unit attacks or is attacked (missing counts for this).
When the meter reaches 10, the next attack from the enemy won't hit.

name: Affinity Strike
title: Affinity Strike
text:
When two units are Paired Up, they can use a combat art named Affinity Strike. 
If the unit kills the enemy, it gains Galeforce, but stats are reduced by 90% for a turn.
Additionally, they inflict a status that depends on the Pair Up partner's affinity.
Enemies can be paired up too. They can also do affinity strikes and in the Lunatic difficulties they can inflict a random status effect.
Affinity Strike's status effects depending on the affinity are:
1. <icon>Fire</> -> Seared{br}2. <icon>Wind</> -> Breached(8){br}3. <icon>Thunder</> -> Stunned
4. <icon>Dark</> -> Cursed/Shadowblight{br}5. <icon>Light</> -> Reduced Vision{br}6. <icon>Ice</> -> Frozen{br}
7. <icon>Anima</> -> (has a 50% chance of inflicting each of Seared, Drenched, Cursed/Shadowblight, Frozen and Rock Punctures)

name: Bonus Experience
title: Bonus Experience
text:
Bonus Experience (BEXP) is a mechanic introduced in FE9. It allows you to give experience to your units with the cost increasing with your unit's level and tier.
Certain actions like visiting villages or houses (now you have an incentive to visit them) can give you more BEXP.
Clearing a map before a turn limit will give you more BEXP. Clearing a level of the Tower of Valni or the Lagdou Ruins also gives BEXP.

name: RNG Method
title: RNG Method
text:
In Hard and Lunatic mode, there are options of 1RN and 2RN. They correspond to the type of RN (Random Number) in hit rate.
1RN: Used in FE1-5. No modifications. A 70% displayed chance to hit is exactly a 70% real chance to hit.
2RN: Used in FE6-13. The engine generates two random numbers and averages them. 
This makes displayed chances to hit above 50% more likely than expected, and those lower than 50% less likely than expected. A 70% displayed chance to hit is actually 82.3%.

name: Growth Method
title: Growth Method
text:
When you start a new game, you'll be asked to choose a growth method.
Random: Truly random growths. For each stat, a random number is rolled between 0 and 99. If the number is less than the growth rate, that stat increases.
Fixed: Units will always have their average stats. A unit with a 50% growth rate is guaranteed to get a stat increase every other level.
Dynamic: Like Random, but it applies a rubberbanding effect to the growth rate. If a unit fails to increase a stat on level-up, next level-up that stat will have a higher effective growth rate.
All methods result in the unit having the same average stat as they level up. 
For instance, a level 1 unit that starts with a Speed stat of 5 and a speed growth of 40, under all three methods, will end up with, on average, a Speed stat of 13 at level 20. 
The only difference is how wide the variance on the results will be, with the Fixed method having no variance, and the Dynamic method have reduced variance compared to the Random method.

name: The Lords
title: The Lords
text:
Both Eirika and Ephraim will have access to the convoy regardless of which route you chose.
Eirika and Ephraim's classes have higher stat caps than other classes from the same tier.
The Lord of the route you didn't choose will return as a Tier 3 unit in chapter 15. That Lord will also have the skills from the Tier 2 class.

name: Paragon
title: Paragon
text: Your trainees and Myrrh have the Paragon skill (makes the unit gain double Experience) when they join. They will lose it upon promoting.

name: Franz
title: Franz
text:
You have the option to have Franz join as a Sword trainee or a Cavalier. He has some special promotions if he starts as a trainee.
His T1 classes besides Sword Cavalier are Knight and Mercenary.

name: Trainees
title: Trainees
text:
Your classic trainees have a special ability that increases their crit chance by their internal level.
Your trainees also have three T1 promotions.{br}Ross can promote to Fighter, Pirate or Barbarian.
Amelia can promote to Knight, Soldier or Wyvern Rider.{br}Ewan can promote to Mage, Shaman or Monk.

name: Joining Level
title: Joining Level
text:
With the exceptions of Amelia, Ewan and Myrrh, units now come at a more reasonable level making easier to use them.
Some will promote when you get them or before the map starts. Beginning with chapter 10, units will begin at T2. At chapter 14, they'll be T3.

name: Hard Mode Bonuses
title: Hard Mode Bonuses
text: Like in FE6 and FE7, units that start as enemies are stronger in Hard and Lunatic mode.

name: Proficiencies
title: Proficiencies
text:
Each unit has an arsenal with their Prf weapons. Your units will unlock and in some cases replace their weapons when they get enough Weapon Experience. 
Some units will replace their Prf weapons after an event.
Some units have new dialog in their joining chapter that indicates their proficiencies and has them in red text, so you can notice it more easily.
Your units' arsenals' description includes icons with their proficiencies, which gives a hint of what they can use on some promotions. 
Keep in mind that some units can't promote to classes that let them use the full arsenal.
Just because two units' arsenals have the same weapon types it doesn't mean that they'll play the same. Their Prf weapons can have different effects/properties.

name: Seth
title: Seth
text:
Seth starts weaker than in the official games. Luckily, he can regain his strength on two ocassions:
His C support with Eirika. {br}A base conversation in chapter 9 (this conversation requires you to keep a certain healer alive).
Both of these events will give Seth stats and increase his growths.

name: Orson
title: Orson
text: Orson's items are exclusive to him and cannot be traded.

name: New Units
title: New Units
text: You can get optional some extra units. They have support bonuses with canon units. You can name them.

name: Playable Monsters
title: Playable Monsters
text:
You can get your own monsters. They're optional and you can obtain them after beating certain maps.
However, a pair of monsters are obtained just before the map starts. They have their own arsenal.
If Lute and/or Knoll are alive, they can revive your fallen monsters after falling in combat even in classic mode.
Your Gorgon starts as a T2 and she counts as being a promoted Shaman. Your Cyclops also starts as a T2 and is considered a promoted Fighter.
Monsters only get promotion choices for T3 classes.{br}There's a new Monster line: the Tarvadour, a support class that is a horse type.

name: My Unit
title: My Unit
text:
You have the option of creating your Avatar. After chapter 1, a new location will appear in the world map.
When creating the optional MyUnit, you'll have to choose a Boon (strong point), Bane (weak point)
and a starting class (only excludes Lord classes) that includes monster classes.
At levels 5 and 15 of each tier, MyUnit will gain another skill from a list of 5 skills that belong to a class from the same tier. This skill can be from a Lord class.

name: Free Actions
title: Free Actions
text: Unlike the original game, certain actions won't end your turn. Support conversations, Talk and using consumible healing items are free actions.

name: Supports
title: Supports
text:
Supports are now easier to obtain, and more similar to how it works in Awakening.
The limit of supports is that you can only have one A support. You can have all the B supports you want.
If you obtained enough points in the previous map to trigger a conversation you can activate it from the base too.
The range for getting support points is now is 2 spaces{br}There are more ways to gain support points besides ending turn near each other:
By interacting (using staves or dancing).{br}By battling on range of the partner.{br}By battling on pair up with a partner.
Support bonuses have been buffed to compensate the increased enemy power.

name: Tiers
title: Tiers
text: Your units can go up to Tier 3, like in FE10. T3 classes have a level cap of 30.

name: Promotions
title: Promotions
text:
Some units may start in the same class and/or promote to the same class, but their promotions can use different weapons or promote to different classes.
When you're in the promotion screen, you can see the weapons that promotion uses and the skills it learns.
Both the Dancer and Manakete classes are T2 classes, which means that they only promote once.
T1 and T2 units promote automatically after their level cap, but they can promote earlier if you use a Master Seal at level 15 or later. 
The Master Seal won't be consumed after being used.
In general, promotions are made so that you don't discard weapons, but there are some exceptions.

name: Skills
title: Skills
text:
All classes learn skills by leveling up. Skills are learned at levels 5 and 15.
Some classes have level 1 skills like Canto for mounted classes or the thief skills.

name: Thieves
title: Thieves
text:
Stealing and opening locks is a bit different here.{br}You don't need lockpicks to open chests/doors.{br}You can steal enemy's unequipped weapons.
There are certain weapons that you can't steal to prevent cheesing certain enemies.
You can steal with a full inventory and they will ask you what item you want to send to the convoy.
Thief units that have sword rank can use daggers. Yes, there are thief classes that don't use swords: Brigands/Barbarians.
Daggers are in general 1-2 range weapons, so your sword locked thieves have better range than in the original game.
Units that have thief skills will retain those skills even if they promote to classes that aren't thief classes.
You don't have to worry about choosing promotions for your thieves on fear that they would lose those skills.

name: Ballistas
title: Ballistas
text:
Ballistas are units instead of  items that your infantry archers can use if there are enough uses left. 
They have low movement and your archer units can promote into them.

name: Cavaliers
title: Cavaliers
text:
Cavaliers can only use one weapon type. Due to branch promotions that can vary depending on the unit,
your cavaliers can end up wielding different weapons even if they start with the same weapon.

name: Class Changes
title: Class Changes
text:
Some classes, for the purpose of effective damage, had their class type change (or added in some cases). 
In the early game, you may find that Mogalls count as flyers and that spiders count as Horses. This applies to their promotions too.
Mogalls can use their personal Light Magic.{br}Myrrh's Manakete class has a level cap of 30 instead of 20 like the other classes. 
Mage Knights use Anima Magic and Swords instead of Anima Magic and Staves. This means that Mage Knight won't be a promotion option for Troubadour.
Your Paladins can use Light Magic.{br}Knights can use more than a weapon type.{br}Wyvern Lords have Axes instead of swords.
Eirika's Great Lord class can use both combat and support Staves.{br}Ewan's promotions are special in the sense that he can keep Anima magic after promotion.
The dancer class counts as a promotion of Monk (Tethys already comes with T1 Monk skills).

name: Base
title: Base
text:
Before a chapter's battle preparations, there's a base like in FE9 and FE10. 
In the base you can give BEXP to your units, see base conversations, and activate support conversations. 
When you select Continue, you'll be sent to the battle preparations screen.

name: The Turnwheel
title: The Turnwheel
text: The Turnwheel (a mechanic that was introduced in FE15) allows you to rewind to a previous point in a map. You have 7 charges that reset after a map.

name: Elements
title: Elements
text:
Magic and some physical weapons have elements associated with them. They can cause statuses and/or can deal super effective damage.
The elements are:{br}<icon>Light</>Light{br}<icon>Dark</>Dark{br}<icon>Water</>Water{br}<icon>Ice</>Ice
<icon>Fire</>Fire{br}<icon>Thunder</>Thunder{br}<icon>Wind</>Wind{br}<icon>Earth</>Earth
Some weapons have multiple elements.{br}If a weapon has an element (or more) associated, the description will indicate it.

name: Residual Damage
title: Residual Damage
text:
In this game, poison is potentially more lethal. Both poison and venom can stack, so the HP loss at the start of the turn can be deadly. 
There's also the bleeding status, that makes you lose HP at the start of the turn and lose speed and it stacks.

name: Effectiveness
title: Effectiveness
text:
There are more types of effectiveness in FE8R. We have effectiveness of unit type and effectiveness of status.
Unit type:{br}<icon>Horse</>Horse{br}<icon>Armor</>Armor{br}<icon>Flying</>Flying{br}<icon>Infantry</>Infantry
<icon>Sword</>Sword{br}<icon>Magic</>Magic{br}<icon>Pirate</>Pirate{br}<icon>Dragon</>Dragon{br}<icon>Monster</>Monster
Status:{br}1. <icon>Drenched</>Drenched{br}2. <icon>Seared</>Seared{br}3. <icon>Shadowblight</>Shadowblight{br}4. <icon>Frozen</>Frozen
Of course, this means that elemental weapons can be more dangerous.

name: Arena
title: Arena
text: You cannot longer farm EXP and money in the arena. Instead, you'll be able to battle an NPC that drops a weapon upon being defeated.

name: Shops
title: Shops
text:
Armories and vendors have a wider variety of items. You'll find more than the classic iron/steel weapons. You can even buy Poison weapons.
You can enter secret shops during the main campaign from the overworld. You don't have to worry about missing out because you skipped a Secret Shop during its chapter.

name: Discount
title: Discount
text: The bad news is that the Silver Card doesn't exist here. The good news is that there are a few classes that learn a skill that reduces the shop prices.

name: Post Battle
title: Post Battle
text:
Taken from Engage, this mechanic allows you to interact with the map after clearing a map. You can do the following:
Train with an ally. You can talk to an ally unit and raise a stat that you want for both your Lord and that unit.
You can train up to 4 times for chapter.{br}Talk with NPCs. You can talk with NPCs placed outside their houses that will give you BEXP.
Other interactions. If you see a shiny spark, and interact with it, it can produce events that can include small reinforcements.

name: Tower and Ruins
title: Tower and Ruins
text:
If you cleared a level of the Tower or the Ruins, when you return you'll be given the option to skip that level.
You won't have to go through weak enemies when you want to grind in the Tower.{br}Clearing later levels ofthe Ruins will give you random weapons.
The Ruins aren't only populated by monsters now. There are human enemies there too. This means that Slayer can't solve all your problems there.
Both the Tower and the Ruins are now randomized. Enemy placements, classes, and inventory may vary. Enemies can also drop stat boosters and accessories.
